title: ChatVLA: Unified Multimodal Understanding and Robot Control with Vision-Language-Action Model
author: Zhongyi Zhou (Midea Group), Yichen Zhu (Midea Group), Minjie Zhu (East China Normal University), Junjie Wen (East China Normal University), Ning Liu (Beijing Innovation Center of Humanoid Robotics), Zhiyuan Xu (Beijing Innovation Center of Humanoid Robotics), Weibin Meng (Tsinghua University), Ran Cheng (Midea Group)
background: This research focuses on unifying vision, language, and action capabilities in robot models, aiming to enhance their understanding and manipulation of physical environments.
contribution: ChatVLA introduces Phased Alignment Training and a Mixture-of-Experts architecture to solve the integration of multimodal understanding and robot control, achieving improved performance across multiple benchmarks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with either catastrophic forgetting in conversational abilities or task interference between control and understanding tasks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances integration by sequentially training on control tasks before merging with multimodal data, alongside segregating expert networks for task-specific processing.

key_innovation: The framework's dual architecture allows it to share attention mechanisms while isolating functionalities specific to either understanding or control tasks efficiently.
real_world_impact: This model enables robots to better interact with their environments and understand language commands, potentially improving automation in varied settings like homes and offices.

new_terms.Phased Alignment Training: **Phased Alignment Training** refers to a staged approach to model training that prioritizes mastering specific tasks before integrating broader capabilities, aimed at reducing knowledge loss.
new_terms.Mixture-of-Experts architecture: **Mixture-of-Experts architecture** is a modeling technique that employs multiple specialized sub-models or 'experts' that can be selectively activated based on the task, improving efficiency and performance.
